channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Virgin 747 in UK emergency landing
item.description: A Virgin Atlantic plane that developed a technical fault en route to Las Vegas has landed safely at London's Gatwick Airport, the airline says.

item.title: Ayatollah posts #BlackLivesMatter
item.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei tweets #BlackLivesMatter amidst tensions in the U.S. over police shootings.

item.title: U.S. targets Al-Shabaab leader
item.description: The United States conducted an airstrike Monday in Somalia against Al-Shabaab, said Navy Rear Adm. John Kirby, Pentagon press secretary.

item.title: Vin Diesel hints at Marvel role
item.description: Vin Diesel, can you be a little more "inhumanly" obvious?

item.title: AirAsia disaster's lasting effects
item.description: News that debris was found after an Indonesia AirAsia flight went missing over the weekend marked the third major incident involving Southeast Asian airlines this year.

item.title: Is AI a threat to humanity?
item.description: Imagine you're the kind of person who worries about a future when robots become smart enough to threaten the very existence of the human race. For years, you've been dismissed as a crackpot, consigned to the same category of people who see Elvis lurking in their waffles.

item.title: A New Year's resolution for work
item.description: Imagine that after a routine medical exam your doctor delivers some devastating news: Since your last checkup your cognitive performance has plummeted.

item.title: The Cuban-American rift
item.description: When Raul Moas took his first trip to Cuba, he plunged deep in the generational chasm among Cuban-Americans that now shapes much of the politics behind this month's historic renewal of U.S.-Cuba ties.

item.title: What really scares terrorists?
item.description: Even terrorists have fears. And the prospect of gender equality appears to rank high on their list of worst nightmares.

item.title: Debris, bodies recovered off Indonesian coast
item.description: Items confirmed to have come from AirAsia Flight QZ8501 Hospitals prepare for bodies Airline boss tweets condolences

item.title: Reports: Debris in Java Sea
item.description: An Indonesian official says that debris has been spotted in the water by crews searching for AirAsia Flight 8501.

item.title: Families see shocking images
item.description: In a briefing by officials, the families of AirAsia Flight 8501 passengers were briefly shown video of bodies in the water.

item.title: Who are passengers?
item.description: The families of those aboard the missing AirAsia plane cope with the unknown. A social media post believed to be the pilot's daughter, reads: "Dad, please come home, I still need you."

item.title: Opinion: Disaster's lasting effects
item.description: News that wreckage was found after an Indonesia AirAsia flight went missing over the weekend marked the third major incident involving Southeast Asian airlines this year.

item.title: MH370 relatives relive agony
item.description: No one can fathom the agony that families of AirAsia Flight QZ8501 are going through -- except the families of MH370.

item.title: Kremlin critic Navalny convicted
item.description: One of Russia's most prominent opposition figures and his brother have been found guilty of fraud in a politically charged trial, state media reported Tuesday.

item.title: 10 dead in ferry blaze; 427 rescued
item.description: Hundreds of desperate passengers are enduring freezing conditions on a stricken ferry that has been burning in the Adriatic Sea for 24 hours. Helicopters have been working through the night to pull them off, one by one.

item.title: Fire at mall kills at least 13 in Pakistan
item.description: A fire sparked by a short circuit at a shop quickly engulfed a three-story shopping center in the eastern Pakistani city of Lahore on Tuesday, killing at least 13 people.

item.title: Senator gave speech for hate group
item.description: Rep. Steve Scalise, the No. 3-ranking House Republican, defended his speech before a a white supremacist forum in 2002 on Monday night, saying he did not subscribe to their philosophy.

item.title: Boy jumps from burning building
item.description: An Alabama man captures chilling video of people jumping to safety during an apartment fire. CNN affiliate WBRC has more.

item.title: Funeral attack leaves 21 dead
item.description: A suicide bomber wearing an explosive vest blew himself up among mourners inside a funeral tent on a farm about 12 miles north of Baghdad, Iraq, on Monday, according to police.

item.title: Obama sorry golf hit wedding
item.description: President Barack Obama apologized to a couple after his golf game in Hawaii forced the bride and groom to relocate their wedding Sunday.

item.title: What Obama said
item.description: A childhood friend of an Army captain whose wedding was moved to accommodate a round of golf for President Barack Obama said the bride and groom had to quickly scramble to find a Plan B. But the agile bride and her wedding party still pulled it all off without a hitch, the friend said.

item.title: Bush remaining in hospital
item.description: Former President George H.W. Bush's breathing "has returned to normal" but he will stay in the hospital Monday night, an aide said. It will be his seventh straight night since being admitted last week.

item.title: Sofia Vergara reportedly engaged
item.description: One of Hollywood's most attractive couples is heading down the aisle.

item.title: MS Dhoni retires from Test cricket
item.description: He is India's most successful Test match captain but Mahendra Singh Dhoni has decided enough is enough.

item.title: Transfer ban: Barcelona hit back
item.description: Barcelona says the transfer ban placed on the club is "disproportionate" and "excessive."

item.title: Ebola patient moved to London
item.description: A health care worker who was diagnosed with the Ebola virus after returning to Scotland from Sierra Leone was transferred early Tuesday to the Royal Free Hospital in London.

item.title: Ebola patient at London hospital
item.description: A health care worker diagnosed with the Ebola virus has been transferred to a London hospital. Nic Robertson reports.

item.title: Ebola virus: What you need to know
item.description: The deadliest outbreak of Ebola virus on record has sparked fears that the killer virus could spread from West Africa to other regions and continents.

item.title: The messy truth about Ebola
item.description: What happens when you get Ebola? CNN's Miguel Marquez explains (Sources: CDC and WHO).

item.title: Ebola fighters Time's 'Person of Year'
item.description: Foday Gallah saw the sick child was distressed and felt he had to do something. So he picked the kid up to comfort him.

item.title: Behind the scenes at the legendary Studio 54
item.description: It has become synonymous with the glamor and excess of the late Seventies. But people who've retained clear memories of Studio 54, the legendary New York nightclub that defined an era, are few and far between.

item.title: Stunning geometric shapes appear in the snow
item.description: If you frequent the pistes of the French Alps, you may see more than just skiers and snowmen scattered around the trails below. For the last 10 years, British artist Simon Beck has been decorating snow-covered lakes and mountainsides with massive geometric designs, often based on fractal patterns, using his footsteps as his implement.

item.title: Strange case of the melting house
item.description: In South London, a life-size wax house is melting. In the city's busy Covent Garden shopping piazza, a building floated above the ground. A 20-minute walk away, a townhouse is flipped on its head.

item.title: Unseen photos of Churchill, Astaire, Garbo and others
item.description: It all started with some boxes that had not been opened for 80 years.

item.title: Discovered: Funny, rude medieval doodles
item.description: My personal favorite is this. At the top of a page of angular medieval text -- full of theological extrapolations and religious devotion -- is a cartoon of a deadpan dog.

item.title: How Victorians dressed for death
item.description: Today, mourning a death in the family often means donning the most formal black outfit in one's closet for one solemn afternoon. But 150 years ago, it was a reason to stash away one's current best and purchase a whole new grief-appropriate wardrobe.

item.title: NASA designs ape-like robot for disasters
item.description: When we imagine the robots of the future, they often look and move like humans, standing up on two legs and using a pair of arms to grab and move objects. NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory is working on a different kind of robot for disaster response that's designed to move like an ape.

item.title: CNN: Witnessing history in 2014
item.description: From Ebola to the fight against ISIS, our reporters have brought you the biggest stories.

item.title: Luxury hotel hides in deepest jungle
item.description: From a luxury longhouse to the steamy heart of the Borneo jungle on the trail of an endangered species.

item.title: Turning footsteps into free energy
item.description: Using a technology that has been around for 130 years, a company called Pavegen hopes to create electricity from everyday human activities.

item.title: 'Africa is not a country' campaign
item.description: They say there are no stupid questions -- but are there? How about, "Do you speak African?"

item.title: MS Dhoni retires from Test cricket
item.description: He is India's most successful Test match captain but Mahendra Singh Dhoni has decided enough is enough.

item.title: 'My cancer cure gamble'
item.description: A cancer sufferer's life changed after watching an episode of Vital Signs. Having failed numerous rounds of chemotherapy Deborah Cummis Sandlaufer was looking for new hope in her treatment for cancer. She came across work by Yale scientists on a new form of cancer therapy by watching Vital Signs and called the team at Yale the next day. She is now taking part in a new trial for ovarian cancer treatment and tells CNN about her experience.

item.title: Swimming face-to-face with sharks
item.description: Alternative headline: These photos put you face-to-face with sharks Photographer Michael Muller is a man without fear. He swims among sharks without the protection of a cage to make studio-quality, intimate photos of these beautiful creatures. As scary as that might sound, the top predators are at the bottom of his list of concerns. He's usually far more concerned about all the gear he brings into the water.

item.title: Man makes millions by shining shoes
item.description: Suede slip-ons, elegant high-heels or lace-up brogues -- whatever shoes you wear in an important business meeting you want to look your shiny best. Some people apply polish with a brush and others choose a cloth, while those coming from afar often leave the task to the capable hands of craftsmen who can make travel-worn footwear look like brand new.

item.title: Pregnant with 2 sets of identical twins
item.description: A couple who endured years of failed pregnancy attempts celebrates with quadruplets.

item.title: Smuggler to self-made safari millionaire
item.description: Alternative headline: From smuggler to self-made safari king Amos Wekesa has seen a lot of changes in his country. Today, the self-made mogul oversees Great Lakes Safaris, one of the largest tour operators in Uganda. He has made millions introducing his clients to the splendor of his country, whether taking them on elephant treks in Queen Elizabeth National Park, or giving them an opportunity to get close to the local chimps at Murchison Falls.

item.title: Admit it - you hate New Year's Eve
item.description: That time of year's coming up again.

item.title: What broke China's Internet in 2014
item.description: The year of outrage also applies to China's Internet users in 2014.

item.title: Low battery? Try a cardboard one
item.description: Red Dot Awards: young designers imagine the future of everyday objects

item.title: Hackers find NASA's lost moon photos
item.description: Techno-archaeologists reveal the search for NASA's lost lunar photos, taken by scuttled lunar satellites.

item.title: Ancient civilization still going strong
item.description: CNN's Ian Lee meets Nubians who have flourished on the banks of the Mighty Nile for thousands of years.

item.title: Ayatollah tweets #BlackLivesMatter
item.description: In blunt tweets, Iran's Supreme Leader compares U.S. police actions to Middle East conflicts.

item.title: Anger at insensitive 'Year in Review'
item.description: Facebook brings back painful memories for those who suffered loss.

item.title: Andy Roddick: Time to scrap Hawk-Eye
item.description: When Andy Roddick played tennis, the grand slam winner and former world No. 1 never shied away from conversing, or arguing with chair umpires.

item.title: 6 quirky restaurants across Africa
item.description: Table? Check. Food? Check. Wine? Check. Shark? Uh ... check! Dine at Africa's most unusual eateries.

item.title: Cat earns how much?
item.description: Black enthusiasm vs. white crime, Grumpy Cat smiles and a mug shot can win you fame.

item.title: Can app solve India's postal chaos?
item.description: Most Indian cities are busy with cluttered streets, winding and hidden alleyways -- every postman's nightmare. Informal structures stand side by side with formal ones making navigation challenging -- even for locals -- and these cities are only going to keep sprawling, fast. Zippr's Aditya Vuchi hopes to fix the broken postal format in India's exploding economy.

item.title: 'What I learned freediving with sharks'
item.description: Andre Hartman struggles to walk. But every day he dreams of going back to the ocean.

item.title: How to make music -- with your eyes
item.description: Ever since Eduardo Miranda met a 'locked in' patient, he's been helping paralyzed people make music.

item.title: Astrophysicist ignites Twitter fury
item.description: It's a number that even astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson is having a hard time wrapping his brilliant mind around.

item.title: Your favorite things about Serbia
item.description: From pristine lakes to crispy white mountaintops, CNN readers share some of the things they love about Serbia.

item.title: Mall shut down after massive brawl
item.description: A huge fight broke out at a mall in Monroeville, Pennsylvania, forcing it to shut down. CNN affiliate KDKA reports

item.title: Can you guess who this is?
item.description: Already boasting a treasure trove of trophies and mementos, the latest addition to Cristiano Ronaldo's own personal museum is a 10-foot bronze statue of the man himself.

item.title: Man cuts off fingers, builds new ones
item.description: A carpenter who lost his fingers in an accident is making mechanical hands for others.

item.title: 13-year-old gets printer for prosthetics
item.description: After getting his own prosthetic hand, this boy wanted to pay it forward and help young people who need the same.

item.title: How can a modern airliner vanish?
item.description: It's the question that keeps popping up. Since the disappearance of MH370, advocates have called for airlines to install tracking systems. Here's why it hasn't happened.

item.title: The best Instagram photos of 2014
item.description: Gone are the days of grainy phone images with the resolution of a poor imitation Monet.

item.title: Pictures
item.description: "The year in pictures" treks across the globe, looking back on the events that shaped 2014.

item.title: Web searches
item.description: In 2013, people just wanted to know how to twerk. It was a more innocent time. This year, people wanted to know if they had Ebola.

item.title: Selfies
item.description: From the red carpet to the Red Planet, these selfies show 2014 in a way you won't find anywhere else.

item.title: AirAsia Flight 8501
item.description: A grim discovery in the waters off Indonesia on Tuesday dealt a heartbreaking blow to families whose loved ones were lost on AirAsia Flight QZ8501, and their anguish was felt around the world.

item.title: Those on board
item.description: A man who was about to be married. Missionaries, a biology teacher and an energy executive. Families on vacation. Pilots with years of experience.

item.title: Ebola in UK
item.description: A health care worker who was diagnosed with the Ebola virus after returning to Scotland from Sierra Leone was transferred early Tuesday to the Royal Free Hospital in London.

item.title: Navalny
item.description: One of Russia's most prominent opposition figures and his brother have been found guilty of fraud in a politically charged trial, state media reported Tuesday.

item.title: Ape-like robot
item.description: When we imagine the robots of the future, they often look and move like humans, standing up on two legs and using a pair of arms to grab and move objects. NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory is working on a different kind of robot for disaster response that's designed to move like an ape.

item.title: Jungle luxury
item.description: Achong is struggling to push our longboat against the current of Borneo's Batang Ai River, so we jump into the water to help him.

item.title: Phone art
item.description: Gone are the days of the grainy camera phone images with the resolution of a poor imitation Monet. Today's smartphone cameras are so advanced that mobile photography is becoming an art form in its own right, turning photo-sharing apps like Instagram into portable galleries for amateur photographers, and professionals like street style photographer Tommy Ton and chief official White House photographer Pete Souza.

item.title: A 'Cereal Killer' idea
item.description: If you miss cereal from your childhood, you can now order up memories at London's Cereal Killer Cafe. Jim Boulden reports.

item.title: Lowriders of Brazil
item.description: CNN's Shasta Darlington takes a look at the lowrider car culture in Brazil.

item.title: Questions for elves...
item.description: 'The Hobbit' elves, Evangeline Lilly, Orlando Bloom and Lee Pace sit down with CNN.

item.title: Who runs ISIS?
item.description: Tom Foreman explains how ISIS's ruthless leader Abu Bakr Al-Baghdadi is quickly making a name for himself.

item.title: Twins reunited on Facebook
item.description: Twin sisters Anais Bordier and Sam Futerman were separated at birth 25 years ago and reunites through social media.

item.title: Surf's up ... in Alaska
item.description: Alaska's Turnagain Arm water is cold but good surfers can ride the bore for miles.

item.title: They take Christmas to a new level
item.description: A California music teacher's insanely elaborate "Star Wars" themed Christmas lights show is dazzling the Internet with its lightsabers and some 100,000 lights choreographed to songs from the movies.

item.title: Extreme hikers go the distance
item.description: They had been in Nepal for a week trying to reach Thorong La Pass, 17,769 feet above sea level, when they were caught in a snowstorm, unable to make it to the nearest village.

item.title: #MyDressMyChoice: Kenyans rally
item.description: Kenyans took to the streets of Nairobi on Monday to send a message to men: Stop attacking women because of the way they dress.

item.title: Perspective-defying photos
item.description: It all started when she kissed the Great Sphinx of Giza.

item.title: I'm a feminist, and I converted to Islam
item.description: I am a Muslim, but I wasn't always. I converted to Islam in November 2001, two months after 9/11.

item.title: China restricts foreign shows
item.description: Almost no current U.S. shows air on China's stations, and it's only getting harder to do so.

item.title: China assures care for boy with HIV
item.description: The Chinese government has pledged to protect an eight-year-old boy with HIV, who was shunned by his entire village in the southwestern province of Sichuan, state media reported.

item.title: China dictates when you can sing anthem
item.description: Don't whisper, applaud or talk on the phone when the anthem is playing. China sets new rules.

item.title: Burqa ban in Chinese city
item.description: Legislators in the capital of China's restive far-western Xinjiang province passed a law Wednesday to prohibit residents from wearing burqas in public, state media reported Thursday, highlighting the government's continued campaign against religious extremism.

item.title: What LA can teach Beijing
item.description: For years China has been the envy of the world, hailed as the great 'economic miracle' thanks to its sustained double-digit growth.

item.title: Security csar Zhou arrested
item.description: China's former top domestic security official, Zhou Yongkang, has been arrested as part of a corruption probe, the country's state-run Xinhua news agency reports.

item.title: The downfall of Zhou Yongkang
item.description: At the height of his power, Zhou Yongkang controlled police forces, spy agencies, court systems and prosecution offices across China -- and the domestic security czar wasn't shy in deploying his vast assets to crush dissent and unrest in the name of "preserving social stability."

item.title: Protesters, police spar in Hong Kong
item.description: Police clashed with activists at the main Hong Kong pro-democracy protest site Monday morning after a violent nighttime standoff when protesters surrounded government headquarters in the city's Admiralty district.

item.title: China: 15 killed in Xinjiang
item.description: Chinese police killed 11 assailants who launched what state media described as a terrorist attack on Friday afternoon at a food market in Xinjiang, in the country's northwest.

item.title: Nightclubs for literature?
item.description: It's midnight in the capital of Taiwan.
